content.rendered:
Johnson Controls organized their COP28 kick-off meeting last week at the Museum of the Future. Apart from a tour of the museum there was an interactive panel discussion on Cracking the code – Decarbonizing the built environment. Currently ongoing, COP28 is the pivotal event shaping the future of global environmental initiatives that aim to have a lasting impact on climate action.

TTE works closely with partner Johnson Controls–Hitachi Air Conditioning to offer sustainable solutions for HVAC that increase productivity while reducing energy costs and carbon footprint. Executive Vice President, Dilip Sharma was part of this event and had the opportunity to interact with Ahmed Aqel, General Manager – Johnson Controls Hitachi MEA, as well as other industry experts.
